title: PBL-CL Instructional Design for Enhancing Scientific Creativity in Early Childhood Education

context.prior_knowledge: Child development theories, basic science pedagogy, and principles of collaborative learning
context.additional_context: Acquiring scientific creativity education strategies for young children in smartphone-based learning environments, targeting current and prospective teachers

learning_goals: Learners will be able to explain the design process of a Problem-Based Collaborative Learning (PBL-CL) module step-by-step.
Educational materials to enhance scientific creativity for young children can be developed by applying the ADIE model
Open-ended scientific inquiry activities suitable for the developmental level of 5-year-olds can be designed
Three or more interactive techniques that promote collaborative learning in mobile environments can be proposed
The content validity and user acceptance of educational materials can be evaluated using formative assessment tools

resources: Early Childhood Creativity Assessment Scale Sample
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
